descriptions.description: Developer turnover reduces the core developer stock as experienced members leave the project.
The skill up flow increases the new contributor stock by transitioning individuals from the onboarding pool.
The skill up flow increases the experienced contributor stock by advancing capable new contributors.
The promotion rate flow increases the experienced contributor stock by recognizing and advancing skilled members.
The promotion rate flow increases the core developer stock by elevating qualified experienced contributors.
Effective mentorship accelerates skill development by providing direct guidance and tacit knowledge.
Effective mentorship increases the promotion rate by preparing contributors for more advanced roles.
More core developers increase mentorship capacity and implicit knowledge transfer opportunities.
Good documentation accelerates skill development by providing accessible learning resources for newcomers.
A larger pool of potential recruits increases the new contributor stock through successful onboarding.
A larger new contributor pool increases the skill up flow as more individuals undergo training.
A larger core developer team can increase turnover due to burnout or career progression.
A larger pool of experienced contributors increases the promotion rate by providing more eligible candidates.
